> [kaffie](#comment_495_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Honestly, if you hate on people for intrinsic traits (weight, skin color, sexuality, etc). you're a disgusting pathetic piece of shit. There's not really any way around that. There's no reason to do it other than just being an asshole.

Actually, it's never like this. Most of the time if someone get me angry I may shoot back the negativity he charged me with in the form of some offensive phrase, and some traits (gay/straight/schizo/normie/nigga/nazi/pathethic/...) are tools to construct it and to fill it with negative emotion. > [kaffie](#comment_495_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): People should have the right (as is naturally assumed) to say what they please. I do not see reason that this should go without consequence or social reactions.

Well, for me, most of the time it's enough to not subscribe to someone who posts stuff I don't like. If he writes something to me directly, I can just block or mute him. But I'm surely not against voluntary "echo chambers" or just any kind of highly-censored communities for those who want them. It's only problem when they want everyone to be part of this community and obey to its rules like antifa.

> [kaffie](#comment_495_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): However, I am okay with web hosting censoring content they do not like. It's their servers, so they should have the final say, regardless of legality.

> [kaffie](#comment_496_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Just an FYI, while indeed it is the same type of speech, there's a difference between literally having hate be your ideology, and simply venting and letting off steam when pent up. Highly ambigous things like this will lead to neverending controversy and misuse. It's a thought police business.

> [kaffie](#comment_497_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): 'free speech' is used as a dogwhistle for right-wing hate groups. It's not truly free discussion the advocates want, it's to be able to hate on people without social consequence. And indeed you see this in their spaces. Try to have a calm rational discussion, and the 'free speech' advocates ban and silence you. They don't want 'free speech' they want 'freedom to hate' ... If you actually asked, most would actually be okay with calmly discussing things. Though, nazi views and fascism get a special exception.

Jeez! This is precisely kind of commie rhethorics that made commies part of my nightmares and delusions. If you can justify things like this today, you may also find some special exceptions to justify killing people tomorrow. And if you try hard enough everyone can be labeled as "nazi symphatizer" if it gets in your way.

I think true anarchist shouldn't even give a fuck about equality, morality, what is good and what is evil. Ideal anarchy is a battlefield in a state of maximum uncertainty where everyone can do any move, no matter how good or evil it is, and everyone else can make a move in response (or independently, not caring about other players). Anarchy gradually becomes worse with more structure on the battlefield. And the worst, opposite to ideal anarchy, is when the whole area of battlefield is a single global state. If "anarchist" says that anarchy is not chaos he is actually a commie or some other kind of socialist/collectivist. For a long time anything close to real anarchy was impossible, but with advancements in technology that make things uncentralizable by design I believe we may proceed probably more than a halfway to ideal anarchy.

1_17X6HcuDcCF3nTTGoCTjZTHFdHV67f3Xqb.body: I see this site uses 2 possible identity providers (zeroid & cryptoid). When some user registers his nickname only on zeroid, anyone else can register the same nickname on cryptoid. To see the identity provider hover your mouse over nickname. It will show full identity including hash.
